Overview

The existing IMA3 plugin provides Ad Tag macro substitution enabling customers to dynamically pass information from a video item to DFP (described here).  While this solves many customer use-cases, the standard functionality does not enable customers to pass variables from their pages nor does it enable the ability to massage data before passing it to the ad tag.  

This document describes a custom plugin adTagManipulate which extends the default Macro replacement behavior.  

Capabilities

adTagManipulate supports the following features:

  • Pass values to the ad tag which are defined on the calling page (for in-page embeds)

  • Pass values to the ad tag via the player query string (for iframe embeds)

  • Allows the customer to define custom code to manipulate the ad tag and values before the standard Macro replacement is called.

Setup and Configuration

  1. Setup IMA3 in the standard way using the studio UI or by loading it via the page.
  2. Add the adTagManipulate script to the Javascript plugins section.

http://solutions.brightcove.com/dbornstein/dev/plugins/adTagManipulate/adTagManipulate.6.js

NOTE: The IMA3 plugin must be loaded BEFORE the adTagManipulate plugin.

  1. Configure the adTagManipulate in the plugin configuration section

Name: adTagManipulate

Options:

{    "debug" : true,

     "pageVariables": {

        "{p1}": "p1VariableName",

        "{p2}": "p2VariableName"

      },

     "queryStringVariables": {

                "{q1}": "q1",

                "{q2}": "q2"

             },

        "customReplaceFunction": {

        "functionName": "removeSemicolonFromAdKeys"

     }

         }

pageVariables defines variables that will be passed from the page itself to the ad tags.

Ad Tag

http://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?env=vp&gdfp_req=1&impl=s&output=vast&cmsid=614&vid=4821964120001&iu=/8484/fort/video_bc&sz=1000x1&cust_params=test%3Dbrightcove&q1={q1}q2={q2}&myp1={p1}&myp2={p2}&unviewed_position_start=1&correlator=[timestamp]

var p1 = "dog"

var p2 = "cat"

<script src="//players.brightcove.net/4113679519001/E1WDVabqx_default/index.min.js"></script>

In this case, {p1} will be replaced with dog and {p2} will be replaced with cat.

queryStringVariables defines variables that will be passed via the query string of the player.

Example:

iFrame Embed

<div style="display: block; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><div style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><iframe src="//players.brightcove.net/4113679519001/E1WDVabqx_default/index.html?q1=hello&q2=goodbye" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen style="width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0px; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; left: 0px;"></iframe></div></div>

Ad Tag

http://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads?env=vp&gdfp_req=1&impl=s&output=vast&cmsid=614&vid=4821964120001&iu=/8484/fort/video_bc&sz=1000x1&cust_params=test%3Dbrightcove&q1={q1}&q2={q2}&p1=P1Value&p2=P2Value&unviewed_position_start=1&correlator=[timestamp]

The name of the name/value queryStringVariable defines the variable name in the query string, in this case q1.  The value defines the Macro that will be replaced. In this example, {q1} will be replaced with hello and {q2} will be replaced with goodbye.

customReplaceFunction defines a javascript function that will be called by the plugin.  The custom function must be defined BEFORE adTagManipulate so the plugin can find the code.  The function can be placed in a standalone .js file and added to the plugins section.

This example defines a function called removeSemicolonFromAdKeys.  If the mediainfo.ad_keys value starts with a semicolon, it will remove it and then do the substitution.  The adTagManipulate plugin will pass three variables to the custom function, the player, debug flag (true/false) and the ad tag URL.  The custom function should return a modified version of the URL.

function removeSemicolonFromAdKeys(player, debug, url) {

        var adKeys = player.mediainfo.ad_keys

        if (adKeys.charAt(0) == ";") {

                if (debug) console.log("custom: Found ; starting adKeys, removing.")

                newAdKeys = encodeURIComponent(adKeys.slice(1))

                if (debug) console.log("custom: new adkeys is: " + newAdKeys)

                if ( url.search( '{mediainfo.ad_keys}' ) ) {

                        if (debug) console.log("custom: replacing mediainfo.ad_keys")

                            newUrl = url.replace( '{mediainfo.ad_keys}', newAdKeys );

                            return newUrl

                  }

        }

        return url

}

Plugin Configuration

NOTE: The adTagManipulate js file should be listed below the IMA plugin in the javascript section and options sections.  If there is a custom function, it should be listed before adTagManipulate.
